newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline a touch firmer, but activity thin.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline a touch firmer, but activity thin.

text.p: NWE gasoline faced thin activity on Thursday, with prices a touch firmer by $1-2 a tonne.
Eurograde barges traded at $214 fob AR and $217 although some dealers felt the later was on the high side, given crude's weakness today.
Ice problems in canals in the ARA region were also causing problems.
"Its worse than it was last week," said one barge trader.
Several traders felt gasoline would be thin since European demand remains modest and the arbitrage to the U.S is no longer an option.
Optimism among some sellers of some strength in the U.S market did not appear to reflect NYMEX gasoline late on Thursday. February was trading around 68.75 cents, off 10 cents.
"I still think the arb will be squeezed open next week," said one trader.
